lead_paragraph: Senator Rand Paul pushed the Kentucky Republican Party to hold its first presidential caucus, but some are asking if he should focus on getting re-elected instead.

headline.print_headline: Higher Hopes Fading, Paul Doesn’t Heed Call of Home
headline.main: Fading Presidential Hopes Complicate Rand Paul’s Senate Re-Election Bid

snippet: Senator Rand Paul pushed the Kentucky Republican Party to hold its first presidential caucus, but some are asking if he should focus on getting re-elected instead.
abstract: Kentucky Sen Rand Paul's attempt to skirt state law disallowing candidate from being on two ballots at once may backfire; is likely to appear on caucus ballot for presidential race he has little chance of winning, which could put him in awkward position of losing contest he engineered; Paul continues to persist in bid for White House despite widespread sentiment he should focus on Senate.
